alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Hyde; Pamlico; Tyrrell; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 22 at 2:10PM EDT until June 22 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Washington County in eastern North Carolina... Hyde County in eastern North Carolina... Eastern Beaufort County in eastern North Carolina... Southwestern Tyrrell County in eastern North Carolina... Northeastern Pamlico County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 209 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Bunyan to Aurora Ferry Terminal to near Florence, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. These thunderstorms have a history of producing wind damage. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Belhaven, Sladesville, Killkenny, Ransomville, Ponzer, Swindell Fork, Scranton, Gum Neck, Kilkenny, Fairfield, Pungo, New Holland, Pamlico Beach, Lowland, Woodley, Edward, Royal, Bonnerton, Rose Bay and Bayview. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
